summary:
Pholcidae is a spider family with over 1,800 species, often called cellar spiders or daddy long-legs. These spiders have long, thin legs and are found worldwide. They were first described by Carl Ludwig Koch in 1850.

The name "daddy long-legs" is shared with other creatures like harvestmen and crane flies, but it commonly refers to the Pholcus phalangioides spider. These spiders are divided into 94 genera, making them a diverse and widespread group.
title: Pholcidae
